URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/10982#issuecomment-907992647


   @Jimexist do we need to update https://github.com/apache/arrow/blob/master/docs/source/developers/documentation.rst as well to mention installation of the datafusion package?
   
   I am not familiar with the automated doc build and publish pipeline, @kszucs @pitrou @lidavidm @wesm @fsaintjacques do we need to update automation to build and install the datafusion python package?
   
   


--

pitrou commented on a change in pull request #10982:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/10982#discussion_r698366336



##########
File path: docs/source/conf.py
##########
@@ -37,14 +37,10 @@
 import warnings
 from unittest import mock
 
+import datafusion
 import pyarrow
 
-
-sys.path.extend([
-    os.path.join(os.path.dirname(__file__),
-                 '..', '../..')
-
-])
+sys.path.extend([os.path.join(os.path.dirname(__file__), "..", "../..")])

Review comment:
       Most of this file is auto-generated. By making style changes we will make it more difficult to diff the current file against a pristine file.




--

pitrou commented on pull request #10982:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/10982#issuecomment-908223360


   I don't think Datafusion is a "supported environment" at the same level as C++, Python, etc. Since this documents the Python Datafusion library, this could go into the "Python" section.
   
   However, since Datafusion is a distinct library from PyArrow (and has its own release schedule), it seems to me it would be better if its documentation lived in a different place altogether. That could be on https://arrow.apache.org, but it could also be hosted on https://readthedocs.org/, for example.
   
   @amol-  What do you think?


--

pitrou edited a comment on pull request #10982:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/10982#issuecomment-908223360


   I don't think Datafusion is a "supported environment" at the same level as C++, Python, etc. Since this documents the Python Datafusion library, it could go into the existing "Python" section.
   
   However, since Datafusion is a distinct library from PyArrow (and has its own release schedule), it seems to me it would be better if its documentation lived in a different place altogether. That could be on https://arrow.apache.org, but it could also be hosted on https://readthedocs.org/, for example.
   
   @amol-  What do you think?


--

amol- commented on pull request #10982:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/10982#issuecomment-908335511


   > I don't think Datafusion is a "supported environment" at the same level as C++, Python, etc. Since this documents the Python Datafusion library, it could go into the existing "Python" section.
   > 
   > However, since Datafusion is a distinct library from PyArrow (and has its own release schedule), it seems to me it would be better if its documentation lived in a different place altogether. That could be on https://arrow.apache.org, but it could also be hosted on https://readthedocs.org/, for example.
   > 
   > @amol- What do you think?
   
   I think I would vote for having datafusion into its own documentation (on readthedocs or anywhere else as you suggested), surely it's not one of the supported environments, but in the end is not even part of libarrow/pyarrow itself so I'd avoid mixing its documentation into the one of pyarrow.


--

   > 
   > However, since Datafusion is a distinct library from PyArrow (and has its own release schedule), it seems to me it would be better if its documentation lived in a different place altogether. That could be on https://arrow.apache.org, but it could also be hosted on https://readthedocs.org/, for example.

houqp commented on pull request #10982:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/10982#issuecomment-911233468


   based on the last reply from @kszucs (https://lists.apache.org/thread.html/r5c9341fe5360ae249532724da2bf92bd2ed661d1c58f599212e82107%40%3Cdev.arrow.apache.org%3E), how about we reuse the current sphinx setup/theme for datafusion, but have a new self-contained website created under `/datafusion`  folder? From there, we could host not just the python api/user doc, but also datafusion user docs in general.


--

fields.summary: Include datafusion's python binding in arrow website

comments.body: This issue was last updated over 90 days ago, which may be an indication it is no longer being actively worked. To better reflect the current state, the issue is being unassigned. Please feel free to re-take assignment of the issue if it is being actively worked, or if you plan to start that work soon.
